trial_identification.studytitle: Incidence of difficult tracheal intubation in bariatric surgery patients.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Patients undergoing bariatric surgery, An observation of tracheal intubation incidence of difficulty.

interventions.interventions: we observe the difficulty of endotracheal tube insertion using the Intubation Difficulty Scale. The following factors were recorded and scored: number of attempts, number of operators, number of alternative techniques, Cormack-Lehane grade, Use of lifting force, Need for laryngyeal pressure and Mobility of vocal cords.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The intubation difficulty score for the patients.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at the time of intubation for bariatric surgery.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at the time of intubation for bariatric surgery.
at the time of intubation for bariatric surgery.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1- BMI > 35 2- participants are undergoing bariatric surgery. 3- ASA I and II
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1- BMI < 35 2- ASA III and IV 3- Known previous difficult airway

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: King Hamad University Hospital, Anaesthesia department PO box 24343 Bahrain

fundingsource.fundingaddress: King Hamad University Hospital, Anaesthesia department PO box 24343 Bahrain

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
This is an observational study that is being carried out at King Hamad University Hospital (KHUH) in Bahrain. Participants for the study included all patients scheduled to undergo Bariatric Surgery with a BMI of >35. Patients were excluded if they were less than 18 years old, or had a BMI of < 35.
Data collected included patients age, gender, weight, height and comorbidities. Pre-operative Anaesthetic Assessment involves noting the procedure the patient is scheduled to undergo, concurrent illnesses, previous surgeries and history of receiving anaesthesia. Patients current medications and allergies are noted. Along with standard pre-operative Assessment, anaesthesiologists ensured recording different measurements including, Neck circumference, Mouth opening (Inter-incisor distance) and any teeth abnormalities.
During the procedure, the position of the patient was noted, along with the induction agents used and size of scope used. Intra-operative assessment was assessed using the Intubation Difficulty Scale. The following factors were recorded and scored: number of attempts, number of operators, number of alternative techniques, Cormack grade, Use of lifting force, Need for laryngyeal pressure and Mobility of vocal cords.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Research and Ethics Committee at King Hamad University Hospital
